reference.shortdesc: The tt (teletype) element is typically used to apply monospaced highlighting to the content of the element.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: For example, for specific items such as inline code fragments, use the codeph element.

section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Although rendering is left up to implementations, processors typically apply monospaced highlighting to the contents of the tt element.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: Make sure that the screen displays File successfully created before proceeding to the next stage of the task.
example.p: While the previous example demonstrates a potential use of tt, it might be more properly encoded using systemoutput.
